Decommission Unix servers

  1. Create change control, get approval and do all the necessary paperwork.
  2. Send ticket to Openview team to stop monitoring the server.
  3. Send ticket to Netbackup team to stop backing up the server.
  4. Send ticket to GIOS Operations Entitlement to remove the server from Entitlement database.
  5. Unmount NFS mounts from clients when necessary and unexport the filesytems.
  6. Return the SAN storage after clearing PVIDs and destroying the VGDA. Send a ticket for cables reclamation and any storage zones etc to delete.
  7. Remove OV client
    sudo /usr/local/scripts/removeOV

    Send a ticket to OV team to remove it from Openview and NNM.

  8. Remove CDs/Tape media from the server.
  9. Shutdown the Operating system.
  10. Remove the host from pgnmsv01:/prod/images/etc/unix_sys_console
  11. Remove the host from pgnmsv01:/prod/images/nimserver-utilities/Disaster.Recovery.List
  12. Remove the host from penmsv01:/prod/images/nimserver-utilities/Disaster.Recovery.List
  13. Remove the host from PowerVM monitoring / LPAR2RRD.
  14. Remove the LPAR/Blade/Frame as applicable.
  15. Remove the HMC/ILO network/VMWare as applicable.
  16. Unrack where applicable.
  17. Request to remove from hardware maintenance. Email System model number and serial number to Robert.
  18. Remove from UUMA
  19. Remove the mksysb backup files.
  20. Remove from NIM definitions.
  21. Send ticket to reclaim DNS names, IP addresses, network ports and cables to Network team.
